content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: IDVAR
      operator: is_valid_reference
      context: RDOMAIN
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0370
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When IDVAR is populated, IDVAR must be a valid variable in the domain
  referenced by RDOMAIN.
Outcome:
  Message: IDVAR does not represent a variable present in the dataset identified in
    RDOMAIN
  Output Variables:
    - RDOMAIN
    - USUBJID
    - IDVAR
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0370
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies
                  the record(s) to which the comment applies.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Item: IDVAR
                Section: Comments
              - Cited Guidance: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class
                  dataset that identifies the related record(s).
                Document: Model v2.0
                Item: IDVAR
                Section: Supplemental Qualifiers
              - Cited Guidance: Name of the  identifying variable in the general-observation-class
                  dataset that identifies the related record(s).
                Document: Model v2.0
                Item: IDVAR
                Section: Related Records
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CO
      - SUPP--
      - RELREC

json.Description: When IDVAR is populated, IDVAR must be a valid variable in the domain referenced by RDOMAIN.

Outcome.Message: IDVAR does not represent a variable present in the dataset identified in RDOMAIN

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies.
Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s).
Name of the  identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s).
